text:
I understand. Especially if you have been doing the one thing for 3 years. It does purely depend on yourself as it's the transition thay can be a little tricky. Nuke is nice I plaid a bit but no expert at all, but its handy to know how it works. Iv not been the best to match a plate with something cg. But once you get the hang of it can be good. 

I understand. Iv got previous modeling experience but I'm still trying to break into modeling very difficult. Iv been modeling for three years on and off professionally. 

Ah I was the worse in my class with modeling but improved over time and it's tough when modeling is hard to go into. Ah I see. Ilm is a nice place . Your mean corridor vfx?
Always good to get a head start on softwares it helps you a lot and prep better.

I think at this stage not to. And try to only send when your 100% happy with each shot you have in your reel. Quality is very important. And if you start sending it now I dont think it would look good for you yet. Because your best piece is judged as the worst piece.
Seems like you are definitely keeping open to areas. But would be good to improve on areas you know currently and on the side pick up the next thing you enjoy and improve for you
You never know where you can land or go tbh
